newsitem.title: USA: Monsanto says gets EPA corn registration.
newsitem.headline: Monsanto says gets EPA corn registration.

text.p: Monsanto Co said it received a registration from the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency for its YieldGard insect-protected corn.
The EPA approval is the second granted for a YieldGard gene and will allow more seed companies to offer YieldGard corn for next spring's planting, Monsanto said.
YieldGard corn is protected against the European corn borer, the company said.
Monsanto said the registration covers technology licensed to Cargill Hybrid Seeds, DeKalb Genetics, Golden Harvest Seeds and Pioneer Hi-Bred International Inc.

The Northrup King unit of Novartis AG, the company being created by the merger of Swiss drug and chemical giants Sandoz AG and Ciba-Geigy AG, completed reviews and received the first registration for corn with a YieldGard gene in August, Monsanto said.

YieldGard corn has completed food and feed safety reviews by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration and has been granted non-regulated status by the U.S. Department of Agriculture, with regulatory reviews under way in Japan and the European Union, Monsanto said.
